definition[0]: to encourage people to support something in an active way
example[0]: an attempt to mobilize popular opinion
example[1]: a campaign to mobilize support for the strike
definition[1]: to start to use the things or people you have available in order to achieve something
example[2]: They failed to mobilize their resources effectively.
definition[2]: if a country mobilizes or mobilizes its army, it prepares to fight a war
definition[3]: to help something to move more easily
example[3]: The physiotherapist mobilizes the patientâ€™s shoulder.
